docs.lead_paragraph: Australian Jarryd Felton won the New Zealand PGA Championship on Sunday with a birdie on the first hole of a three-way playoff.

headline.print_headline: Australia's Felton Wins NZ PGA in Playoff
headline.main: Australia's Felton Wins NZ PGA in Playoff

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Police Department says no evidence of vandalism has been found at a predominantly Jewish cemetery where more than 40 tombstones were toppled over.

headline.print_headline: NYPD: No Evidence of Vandalism at Largely Jewish Cemetery

docs.lead_paragraph: The energy sector is the stock market's dud so far in 2017 after a banner performance in 2016, and the rest of the year may also be rocky for investors due to the unclear path for crude oil prices.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Energy Stocks, Darlings Last Year, Stumble in 2017

docs.lead_paragraph: China pledged more support for its military on Sunday including strengthening maritime and air defenses as it takes steps to safeguard its sovereignty, but in a highly unusual move did not give spending figures for 2017 despite promises of transparency.

headline.print_headline: China to Strengthen Defenses, No Word on Budget
headline.main: China to Strengthen Defenses, No Word on Budget

docs.lead_paragraph: China will cut steel capacity by 50 million tonnes and coal output by more than 150 million tonnes this year, its top economic planner said on Sunday as the world's No. 2 economy deepens efforts to tackle pollution and curb excess supply.

headline.print_headline: China Vows New Steel, Coal Capacity Cuts to Make Sky Blue
headline.main: China Vows New Steel, Coal Capacity Cuts to Make Sky Blue

docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang pledged Sunday to make the country's smoggy skies blue again and "work faster" to address pollution caused by the burning of coal for heat and electricity.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nikolay Goldobin assumed his first goal with the Vancouver Canucks would simply cap off a comfortable win in his debut for his new team. It proved to be far more valuable than that.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Soccer Federation has instituted a policy that requires players on a national team to "stand respectfully" during national anthems, the New York Times and other media reported on Saturday.

headline.main: U.S. Soccer Players Must Stand for National Anthem
